alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Gaines; Martin (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 8:02PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Andrews, eastern Gaines, northwestern Martin and western Dawson Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 802 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Tokio to near Seagraves Airport to 10 miles east of Gaines County Airport to 6 miles west of Andrews. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seminole, Seagraves, Seagraves Airport, Gaines County Airport, Welch, Loop, Florey, Punkin Center, McKenzie Lake and Gaines County Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
